newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France holds intervention rate unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France holds intervention rate unchanged.

text.p: The Bank of France said on Monday it was leaving its intervention rate unchanged at 3.25 percent at a money market tender.
Economists had not expected a cut. Call money, an unofficial rate closely steered by the Bank of France, was lowered on Monday morning.
The Bank continued to post its five-to-10 day rate at 4.75 percent.

The intervention rate, at which the central bank allocates repo funds, was last cut -- from 3.35 percent -- on September 19, 1996. On August 1 the Bank cut 15 basis points off its five-to-10 day rate from 4.90 percent.
